Kody Gilleo

Here's a bit about me...

BIO

I completed my Associates of Applied Science in Computer Science with a 3.88 cumulative GPA. Throughout my academic career I learned HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, Javascript, Java, and Python. In my free time I took it upon myself to learn the basics of SCSS (which was used in the production of my portfolio), React, and Django. To see some of my project, please visit the "My Work" page!

Big Sky Harley Davidson

Internet Sales manager

  • Management of internet sales through an E-commerce platform
  • Designing and modifying of e-mail templates to offer a clean, professional form of communication to customers
  • Transferring data from our online platform to our local POS system
  • Analytics of profit and loss reports from our E-commerce platform
  • Creating promotions, events and packages to drive sales for holidays and special occasions
  • Resolving customer issues in a professional manner while still Maintaining a profit for the company
  • Applying shipping algorithms to ensure profits are not lost to excess shipping costs
  • Maintaining our online shop to keep our website looking up to date and competitive in an ever changing market
  • Applying coding to our website to ensure smoothness of operation across multiple devices, platforms and software for every customer
  • Use of computer programming knowledge to apply coding into email templates for accuracy in email responses

Acme Auto Body

Parts Specialist

  • Communicating with the office to ensure all parts are ordered in a timely manner
  • Opening received parts to check for quality and accuracy against work orders
  • Sorting, organizing and labeling received parts for storage for ease of finding when technicians need parts
  • Assisting technicians with parts removal and assembly between working on parts
  • Removing and installing auto glass when requested by other technicians
  • Working along side technicians to learn the trade for future opportunities to become and Auto-body technician
  • Providing transportation for customers needing a ride to their vehicle or place of work
  • Learning additional skills, such as sanding, welding, disassembly, and small parts organization to provide assistance to all technicians
  • Shop and yard cleanup to maintain a cleanly appearance for customers and a safe work environment for everyone
  • Carefully organizing vehicles to provide easy access for technicians
  • Driving a large variety of vehicle sizes with various mechanical problems without causing damage to vehicles or property

Safelite Group

Certified Glass Technician

  • Working in all types of weather and temperature
  • Driving company vehicles while following regulations set forth by the company to ensure the safety of myself and others as well as ensuring all glass arrives to the working location without damage
  • Working diligently and efficiently with little to no supervision
  • Contacting all customers at the start of each day to create a plan and route
  • Lifting and carrying 50 lbs regularly
  • Maintaining a clean and organized work area both on the road and in shop
  • Finding solutions to a wide assortment of unforeseen issues
  • Creating solutions for issues created by previous replacements
  • Communicating and meeting an expected arrival time, completion time, and safe drive away time for each customer
  • Consistently communicating changes throughout the day to my supervisor
  • Performing daily, weekly and monthly inspections on company vehicles
  • Performing a daily check of all materials for both the shop and mobile vehicles to ensure sufficient supplies to complete the day
  • Adapting easily and quickly to changes made throughout the day by my supervisor, my coworkers, and my customers
  • Maintaining proper documentation for each work order presented throughout the day
  • Assisting other technicians with vehicles without falling behind on the work assigned to me
  • Arriving early to work to start the day on time if traveling to another area for the day
  • Staying late as needed to ensure all work is completed the day it is assigned
  • Checking and verifying all parts on a work order before beginning the work to ensure a quality replacement
  • Following all local, state and federal regulations for a safe, quality installation on every vehicle
  • Handling unexpected adverse conditions (such as rust, use of improper adhesive with a previous installation, dents in bonding area, and broken glass) while still completing the work in the agreed upon time with the customer
  • Notifying all customers about warranty info, safety precautions and safe drive away times
  • Wearing proper safety equipment at appropriate times (cut resistant gloves while handling glass, chemical resistant gloves while handling chemicals)
  • Creating an optimal working environment for replacement in many different types of terrain and conditions
  • Completing and passing all required training within an allotted time frame to become certified with the company for auto glass installations and repairs
  • Following strict regulations set forth by the company for proper windshield installation to ensure the safety of our customers
  • Operating power tools in awkward and confined spaces
  • Critical thinking and problem solving my way through vehicles that I had no experience with while still completing the work order in the time frame agreed upon with the customer
  • Attention to detail across large areas to ensure quality workmanship
  • Creatively fixing potential warranty issues in a way that will not cause problems for future replacements
  • Creating, processing and completing claims for customer with insurance
  • Accepting and resolving customer complaints to ensure returning customers
  • Training and assisting new technicians without slowing down my own work
  • Following all FMVSS and ANSI standards for safe installations for each customer
  • Extensive knowledge of all work processes to answer any questions or concerns customers may have about the work being done on their vehicle
  • Knowledge of relative humidity, temperature and weather and how such conditions affect flash off times and dry times for adhesives and chemicals
  • Completing productive tasks during down time
